Dear Mr. Risinger:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
09/29/21. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be
noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules. The corrective action plan is due 15
days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of inspection
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (269) 337-5289.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.10113 Employee records.
Three references which are obtained before employment from
persons unrelated to the employee.
Four of six new employee files reviewed contained written references that were
undated, making it unable to determine if they were completed prior to employment.
R 400.10121 Direct care worker; qualifications.
(1) A direct care worker shall have completed 30 semester
hours of college or equivalent quarter hours.
(2) In place of meeting the requirement specified in subrule (1)
of this rule, a direct care worker shall have a minimum of a high
school diploma or its equivalent and 2 years of work experience
in a facility of child caring institution.
One of six new employee files reviewed was found to have only 27 of the 30 college
credits required for direct care staff and did not have 2 years related experience at
the time of hire. As part of the CAP for this item, the facility would need to submit a
variance request to continue the employee’s employment, unless the remaining 3
credit hours can be accounted for.
4

R 400.10125 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(3) In addition to the orientation training, a facility shall
document that each direct care worker received 24 clock hours
of planned training annually.
One of three existing employee files was found to have only 22.5 of the required 24
hours of annual training.
R 400.10125 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(4) A facility shall establish and follow a written plan of ongoing
staff training related to the facility's function, which shall include
all of the following areas:
(b) Child management techniques.
(d) Appropriate discipline, crisis intervention, de-escalation
techniques, and child handling techniques.
(g) Proper and safe methods and techniques of restraint.
One of nine employee files reviewed was found to be overdue for restraint training
by two months. The facility policy calls for annual training.
R 400.10315 Initial service plan.
(1) An initial service plan shall be completed and recorded by
the social worker for each facility resident within 30 days of
admission.
Two of three current resident files were found noncompliant with the rule. One of the
files did not contain an ISP for a youth who transitioned from detention into the
treatment program. An ISP is required within 30 days of admission to the treatment
program. The second file contained an ISP authored by the youth’s probation officer
and not the social worker. The probation officer is not an employee of the facility.
5

R 400.10315 Initial service plan.
Specific steps and time frames for addressing the problems,
achieving the objectives, and meeting the needs of the resident.
The current facility format does not include all of the required information such as
specific steps and time frames.
R 400.10315 Initial service plan.
Documented approval of the plan by the social service
supervisor.
One of two ISPs reviewed was approved by the “Deputy Director of Juvenile
Services for the Monroe County court.” This person is not an employee of the facility
and credentials can’t be verified to determine whether they meet the qualifications
for social service supervisor. The plans must be written and approved by current
employees of the facility.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility does not serve DHHS youth and does not fall under MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility does not contract with the Department.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
R 113 Employee records
The facility is advised to ensure that their annual central registry clearances do not go
over one year.
R 317 Updated Service Plan
The facility was advised to ensure they amend the language in their USP template to
fully document part (3)(b) of the rule.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
6

R 101 Definitions (cc) Volunteers
It is highly recommended that the facility ensures that both criminal and central
registry clearances are completed for all volunteers and that there is standardization
in the files for volunteers.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
The facility has not been required to submit any acceptable corrective action plans
not related to maltreatment during this licensing period. There have been no special
investigations and there were no violations on the last inspection.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
